meanings.sent1: The rabbit skirred across the field.
meanings.sent2: She skirred through the crowd to catch the bus.
meanings.sent3: The leaves skirred playfully in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Time skirred by as they danced under the stars.
meanings.sent5: The water skirred over the rocks, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: To flee in a sudden or hasty manner
meanings.sent1: The mouse skirred away from the cat.
meanings.sent2: He skirred out of the room when he heard the alarm.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel skirred up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent4: Fear skirred through her veins as she heard the loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The birds skirred from the tree as the storm approached.
